page.title: 07FARMING 2
page.content: Farming is the main primary industry with the area divided between large estates with only a few owners. One such is Mr Alistair Ferguson. In general the ground is good quality and grows crops well, usually potatoes, barley, swedes, rape grass and some soft fruit. A lot of the grass is made into winter fodder for the animals: Blackface sheep with some Suffolk- Border Leicester, and Friesian heifers. Modern farming employs much expensive machinery: Mr Ferguson owns five fairly new tractors, a combine harvester, forage harvester and a New Holland bailer plus various implements The area of ground he owns stretches from Auchnayle to Killiecrankie, with heights ranging from 2,575 to 350 feet. Three shepherds control the flocks which wander the high ground.
